argument.name: CookieName as C
argument.description: The name of the cookie to look for.

discussion.p: The *[xb:Context.Request.HasCookie]* method checks to see if *[xb:CookieName]* exists. If the cookie exists, *[xb:HasCookie]* returns *[xb:.t.]*, otherwise it returns *[xb:.f.]*.
Use *[xb:Context.Request.Cookies.Get(CookieName)]* to get the cookie. *[xb:Context.Request.Cookies.Get]* returns a [System::Web::HttpCookie].

page.note: You can call *[xb:Context.Request.Cookies.Get(CookieName)]* without checking if the cookie exists. However, if the cookie does not exist, *[xb:Context.Request.Cookies.Get(CookieName)]* will create the cookie. Use *[xb:HasCookie]* to check if the cookie exists before getting the cookie from the *[xb:Context.Request.Cookies]* object.
page.example: dim cookieName as c cookieName = "CustomCookie" if Context.Request.HasCookie(cookieName) then ?"The cookie exists." + crlf() ?Context.Request.Cookies.Get(cookieName) else ?"The cookie doesn't exist." + crlf() end if
